(43y119tb Ck^risiohs;1HFAR CABINET 119 (43).CONCLUSIONS\.oj1 a Meeting of theWar Cabinet held at Id Downing Street,' S.W.1, on Wednesday, 25th August, 1%43; at 6 f,m.Present:The Right Hon. C R. Attlee, M.P., Deputy Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.The Right Hon. Oliver Lyttelton,M.P., Minister of Production.The following were also present:Colonel the Right Hon. oliver stanley, M.P., Secretary of Statefor the Colonies. .The Right Hon. Sir archibald sinclair, Bt., M.P., Secretary ofState for Air.The Right Hon. Richard Law, M.P.,Parliamentary Under-Secretary ofState for Foreign Affairs.Air Marshal Sir Douglas Evill, Vice-Chief of the Air Staff.The Right Hon. A. V. Alexander,.M.P., First Lord of the Admiralty.The Right Hon. Sir Stafford Cripps,K.C., M.P., Minister of aircraft production.Sir Orme Sargent, Deputy Under-Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.Vice-Admiral Sir Neville Syfret,Vice-Chief of Naval Staff.Lieutenant-General A. E. Nye, Vice-Chief of the Imperial General Staff.Secretariat: -Mr. Norman Brook, *./Lieutenant-Colonel D. The Parliamentary Undersecretary, oj' State(-fffifcoMifj/n'Affairs said that some time ago the Begent of bra%Juiij^Bpi^tAa wish to visit this country with a view to seeing something of thenation's war effort/ jThei^ in such a visit; butit was how proposed that the Regent should be accompanied byNuri Pasha. This put the matter in a somewhat different light, asit would certainly be embarrassing to have Nuri Pasha in this-country. at I the present time, The Fo&eig& Office recommended &hafcall practtcaMe steps sbxsuld be taken -todisccHarage Nttri Pasha fromvisiting this country.The Secretary of State for the Colonies endorsed the view expressed on behalf of the foreign Office. He added that, if it were found impracticable to prevent Nuri, Pasha from coming' to. :fchiscountry, it should be made clear in advance that he was not cominghere for the jwtrpose of discussions regarding the future ofPalestine.The War Cabinet- vEndorsed the views expressed by the Secretary of Statefor the Colonies and the Parliamentary Under-Secretaryof State for Foreign Affairs, and asked that aU practicable steps Should he taken to discourage Nufi Pasha fromvisiting this country at the present time.Offices of the War Cabinet, S.W. 1,2bfh August, 1943.
